description:
Saving Lives with Early Detection

Saving Lives with Early Detection

At HALO Diagnostics (HALO Dx), we recognize every patient is unique. Our focus is early detection and precision-focused healthcare preventing and conquering the top health diseases that have a geometric impact on patient outcomes. We're able to provide our patients specialized care for their particular needs. From Vascular and Interventional Radiology to Orthopedic and Sports Medicine, Neuroradiology to Whole Body Imaging, our radiologists have the specialized training and experience to diagnose, and, in some cases, offer minimally invasive treatment for a wide variety of health conditions.

Join us as a Patient Navigator specializing in imaging and Hereditary Cancer Testing. This full-time opportunity has a Monday - Friday 8:30am - 5pm schedule, and is located in Burbank, CA. Our Patient Navigators play a pivotal role in collaborating with our clinical team to provide an exceptional patient experience to a diverse patient population in an outpatient setting. In addition to competitive compensation, we offer a comprehensive benefits package, including stock options in a rapidly expanding health tech company with locations nation-wide. Don't miss this incredible opportunity to advance your career with HALO Precision Diagnostics. Our ideal candidate has at least 1 year of recent medical office experience coordinating with a team of medical professionals. Candidate must be bilingual in English and Spanish.

Responsibilities

  • Genetics education for high-risk patients.
  • Registration and scheduling follow up appointments for genetic testing.
  • Collection of specimens for genetic testing.
  • Liaison between patient, Radiologist, Pathologist, and Referring Physicians.
  • Insurance verification and authorization.
  • Maintain compassion and professional demeanor with patients in a fast paced environment.
  • Distribute positive genetic test results to referring physicians.

Qualifications:

  • 1 year of medical office experience in imaging highly preferred.

Applicants should be prepared to demonstrate their technical skills through a comprehensive assessment as part of the selection process.

Why join us – we offer you the following!

  • The ability to save lives with early detection!
  • A Monday – Friday schedule
  • Full benefits including medical/dental/vision/life - most are paid 100% by the company
  • Stock options
  • Paid vacation / holidays and sick time
  • 401k plan
  • Advancement and training opportunities

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $22.00 - $25.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Flexible spending account
  • Health insurance
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • 8-hour shift

Work setting:

  • In-person

Work Location: In person
